title: New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: The New Package Wizard displays a confusing message when creating a new Java package.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package Wizard, before entering any package name, a message appears at the top of the wizard that says, 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists.' The package name field is empty at this point.
EB: When invoking the New Java Package Wizard, there should be no message displayed when the package name field is empty. If there is a situation where the package name field is invalid or already exists, it should be clearly indicated as an error message, possibly with an error icon.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new Java Project.
2. Select the newly created project.
3. Invoke the New Package Wizard.
